revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins.In the year 2000 coins were launched in the series: "Animals of the World", "Castles and palaces of Poland", "Polish kings and princes" and various occasional coins. {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| The [[Year 2000]] - the turn of [[millennium]]s{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000/millenium_200zl.html | title=The Year 2000 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' outer ring: 900/1000 Au
inner ring: 925/1000 Ag
core: 900/1000 Au | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 6,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 16 February 2000{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2000 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|13.60|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 1.200 zÅ {{Cite journal|title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In the centre, a stylized image of the globe and orbits. Below, the date of issue: 2000. Above, on the left side, an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the rim the legend: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA 200 ZL. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: A stylized combination of fragments of: figures in the [[binary notation]], [[printed circuit]], [[DNA]] molecule, and [[elementary particles]]. In the inner ring, an inscription: ROK 2000 (year 2000). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[Great Jubilee|The Great Jubilee of the Year 2000]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000/jubileusz_10zl.html | title=The Great Jubilee of the Year 2000 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-13}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Olszewska-Borys | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 60,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 8 March 2000 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 100 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In the center, an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland against the background of a stylized rosette. Below, an inscription: 10 ZÅ. On the rim, the legend: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA 2000. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Against the background of a cross, in the central part, joint Greek letters: X (chi) and P (rho) - the Christ's monogram, and A (alfa) and Ï (omega) - an early Christian symbol of Jesus Christ. Between the cross's arms, symbols of Evangelists: a man and an inscription: Åw. Mateusz ([[St. Matthew]]), a lion and an inscription: Åw. Marek ([[St. Mark]]), a bull and an inscription: Åw. Åukasz ([[St. Luke]]), and an eagle and an inscription: Åw. Jan ([[John the Evangelist|St. John]]). In the rim, an inscription: WIELKI JUBILEUSZ ROKU 2000 (the Great Jubilee of the Year 2000). On the side an inscription: WIELKI JUBILEUSZ ROKU 2000 twice repeated, separated with stars (the Great Jubilee of the Year 2000). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[Congress of Gniezno|The 1000th anniversary of the convention in Gniezno]] (gold 200 zÅ){{Cite web| url=http://nbp.pl/Home.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000/gniezno_200.html | title=The 1000th anniversary of the congress of Gniezno golden 200 zl coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-15}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 1,250 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 8 March 2000 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 17,000 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the right, in a stylized oval, an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland, and the year of issue: 2000. On the left, a stylized image of the obverse of [[Boleslaw Chrobry]]'s coin ([[denar]]). A semicircular inscription above: RZECZPOSPOLITA. Below, an inscription: 200 ZÅ. At the bottom, a semicircular inscription: POLSKA. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Stylized images of sitting both Boleslaw Chrobry and [[Otto III]]. At the background, an ornament and elements of the [[Roman architecture]]. Above, a semicircular inscription: 1000-LECIE (1000th anniversary). At the bottom, a stylized lion on a runner. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Bust of the King Jan II Kazimierz. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Half figure of the King Jan II Kazimierz. On the sides of the image dates: 1648, 1668. Below a semicircular inscription: Jan II Kazimierz. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[Polish Museum, Rapperswil|Polish Museum in Rapperswil]] - 130th Anniversary of Foundation{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000/Rapperswil_10.html | title=Rapperswil Museum coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-19}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Olszewska-Borys | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 25,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 18 October 2000 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 130 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland, under the Eagle description: ZÅ 10 ZÅ. On the left side a stylised image of a fragment of Rapperswil Castle, on the right side a stylised image of a fragment of the [[Royal Castle in Warsaw]]. Above an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA / POLSKA / ROK 2000 (Year 2000). Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: A stylised image of a fragment of Bar Column: a fragment of shaft, capital, sphere and eagle. On the left side inscription: MAGNA / RES / LIBERTAS and semicircular inscription: MUZEUM POLSKIE (Polish Museum). On the right side inscription: 1870 / 2000 and semicircular inscription: W RAPPERSWILU (in Rapperswil). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 30th Anniversary of [[Polish 1970 protests|the December Events in 1970]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2000/grudzien_10zl.html | title=30th Anniversary of December Events in 1970 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-19}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 oxidized (Oxidized Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 37,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 16 November 2000 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 120 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the left side an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Centrally, uneven pavement with a stylised image of the emblem of the Republic of Poland on it. Below an inscription: 10 zÅ. Beneath, a semicircular description: Rzeczpospolita Polska, below the year of emission: 2000. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Centrally, pavement with stylised figures of people on it. Above, an inscription: 30. rocznica / ' 70 (30th Anniversary / of December ' 70). On the side an inscription: [[GdaÅsk|GDAÅSK]] [[Gdynia|GDYNIA]] [[Szczecin|SZCZECIN]] [[ElblÄg|ELBLÄG]] [[SÅupsk|SÅUPSK]] separated with asterisks. |- | colspan="4" |   |} ==See also== * [[Numismatics]] * [[Regular issue coinage]] * [[Coin grading]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Polish currency and coinage}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Commemorative Coins Of Poland: 2000}} [[Category:Commemorative coins of Poland]]
